(v)  
Two (2) ‘A’ level passes in Yoruba, and any of English, 
Christian Religious Studies / Islamic Studies, Igbo, 
French, History, Geography and Arabic.  
Candidates must also satisfy the UTME requirements. 
LASU accepts 'A' level passes in English Language, 
Arabic, Geography, Physics or History/ Government.  
TASUED accepts two (2)'A' level passes or NCE merit 
including Yoruba and another Arts or Social Scien ce 
subject.  
      
  
   (vi)   
  
AAUA accepts NCE merit including Yoruba and another 
Arts or Social Science subject  
      
UTME  
(i) LASU and LAGOS require 'O' level credit pass in 
Mathematics.  
(ii) TASUED requires five (5) 'O' level credit passes at one 
(1) sitting or six (6) 'O' level credit passes at two (2) 
sittings to include English Language and any other 
Arts or Social Science subjects.  
(iii) LAGOS requires five (5)‘O’ level credit passes 
including English Language, Mathematics, Yoruba 
and two (2)of Literature in English, Economics, 
History/Government, French/Arabic, Christian 
Religious Studies / Islamic Studies/WATR (West  
African Traditional Religion),and Civic Education.  
(iv) AAUA requires Five (5) 'O' level credit passes at two 
(2) sittings including English Language, Yoruba, 
Literature in English, Mathematics and one (1) Arts 
subject.  
  
UTME SUBJECTS  
(i) LAGOS requires Yoruba and two (2) of  
Government/History, Literature in English,  
French/Arabic, Christian Religious Studies / Islamic 
Studies, Geography, Economic/Commerce.
